itemDescription: Welsh rugby union and rugby league footballer

wikipedia_page.main: Howell John Davies (11 March 1885 – 2 July 1961) was a Welsh rugby union and professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1910s. He played representative level rugby union (RU) for Wales, and at club level for Pontypool RFC, as a hooker, i.e. number 2, and club level rugby league (RL) for Hunslet, as a forward (prior to the specialist positions of; prop, hooker, second-row, loose forward), during the era of contested scrums.

response: Sir (William) Howell Davies (13 December 1851 – 26 October 1932) was a Welsh-born leather merchant and Liberal politician.
